title: 3D Mapping — Autonomous Crawler
summary: Master's Degree Final Project: The goal is to perform 3D mapping using RTAB-Map, and then use the generated map to enable autonomous navigation.

title: Prototyping — Sorting Center
summary: Design and prototyping of a sorting center: color-based sorting using 3D-printed parts and cardboard, with BLE connectivity to a mobile app.

title: Escape Room Development
summary: Camera management and device orchestration with Node-RED and microcontrollers. Game development in C and Python, complemented by 3D modeling.

title: Robot for Exploration
summary: Inter-departmental project: I mainly worked on setting up the Raspberry Pi and the LiDAR, then I worked on the data flow between the robot and the control station.

title: Simulated Car Control via CAN
summary: The goal was to get familiar with the simulator and control the car by sending CAN frames so that it could autonomously follow the road.

title: Exploring ROS with Drone Control
summary: Applied ROS fundamentals (nodes, topics, messages, actions, pub/sub) to drone control and QR-code detection

title: Robot Pepper Development
summary: Studying the functionality of the Pepper robot and programming it with Python 2.7.

title: Getting Started with Computer Vision
summary: Discovering Computer Vision: From Basic Algorithms to Advanced Models like YOLO/SSD, with Custom Object Recognition

title: Precise Motor Control Using STM32
summary: Accurate control of a DC motor equipped with a magnetic encoder using a PID controller, for regulating speed, absolute position, and relative position based on IMU data.
